byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Los Angeles, and Timothy Williams from New York.
byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS

abstract: Los Angeles County approves plan putting wide restrictions on use of solitary confinement for juveniles in county detention facilities; plan allows for solitary confinement only for brief periods in county has one of nation's biggest juvenile justice systems.
lead_paragraph: A plan approved by the Board of Supervisors allows for the use of solitary confinement only for short periods, after consultation with a mental health professional.

headline.main: Los Angeles County Restricts Solitary for Juveniles
